# Schedule

Prior to each class please read and watch everything listed under discussion. You should have also completed the homework assignment from the week prior by Monday night. 

You may wish to also review some of the recommended resources. I would suggest reading these after class, since I will emphasize what is important during my lectures and lab tutorials. 

Note that this schedule may change.

# Learning Outcomes

By the end of this course, you should be able to:

1. Explain what digital trace data is
2. Explain what internet protocols are and why they matter
3. Use the Tidyverse to wrangle and visualize data
4. Use the R programming language to scrape the web, access APIs, and implement basic text analysis tasks
5. Formulate quantitative sociological research questions and address them using data and evidence
